segment.source: Configure E-Mail Security for AGPM
segment.target: Configure E-Mail Security for AGPM

segment.source: Configure E-Mail Security for AGPM
segment.target: Configure E-Mail Security for AGPM

segment.source: Configure E-Mail Security for AGPM
segment.target: Configure E-Mail Security for AGPM

segment.source: By default, e-mail notifications sent because of actions in Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) are not encrypted and are sent through SMTP port 25.
segment.target: By default, e-mail notifications sent because of actions in Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) are not encrypted and are sent through SMTP port 25.

segment.source: However, you can configure e-mail security for AGPM by using registry settings to specify whether to use Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) encryption and which SMTP port to use.
segment.target: However, you can configure e-mail security for AGPM by using registry settings to specify whether to use Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) encryption and which SMTP port to use.

segment.source: By encrypting AGPM e-mail notifications, you can better protect those that could reveal sensitive information about your organization’s security.
segment.target: By encrypting AGPM e-mail notifications, you can better protect those that could reveal sensitive information about your organization’s security.

segment.source: Encrypting e-mail notifications is recommended when they are being relayed through remote mail servers, and may be required by some compliance regulations.
segment.target: Encrypting e-mail notifications is recommended when they are being relayed through remote mail servers, and may be required by some compliance regulations.

segment.source: Caution
segment.target: Caution

segment.source: Incorrectly editing the registry may severely damage your system.
segment.target: Incorrectly editing the registry may severely damage your system.

segment.source: Before making changes to the registry, you should back up any valued data on the computer.
segment.target: Before making changes to the registry, you should back up any valued data on the computer.

segment.source: A user account that has the AGPM Administrator (Full Control) role, the user account of the Approver who created the Group Policy Object (GPO) used in these procedures, or a user account that has the necessary permissions in AGPM is required to complete these procedures.
segment.target: A user account that has the AGPM Administrator (Full Control) role, the user account of the Approver who created the Group Policy Object (GPO) used in these procedures, or a user account that has the necessary permissions in AGPM is required to complete these procedures.

segment.source: Review the details in "Additional considerations" in this topic.
segment.target: Review the details in "Additional considerations" in this topic.

segment.source: To configure e-mail security for AGPM by using Group Policy preferences
segment.target: To configure e-mail security for AGPM by using Group Policy preferences

segment.source: In the Group Policy Management Console tree, edit a GPO that is applied to all AGPM Servers for which you want to configure e-mail security.
segment.target: In the Group Policy Management Console tree, edit a GPO that is applied to all AGPM Servers for which you want to configure e-mail security.

segment.source: (For more information, see Editing a GPO.)
segment.target: (For more information, see Editing a GPO.)

segment.source: In the Group Policy Management Editor window, expand the Computer Configuration, Preferences, Windows Settings, and Registry folders.
segment.target: In the Group Policy Management Editor window, expand the Computer Configuration, Preferences, Windows Settings, and Registry folders.

segment.source: In the console tree, right-click Registry, point to New, click Collection Item, and type AGPM e-mail security.
segment.target: In the console tree, right-click Registry, point to New, click Collection Item, and type AGPM e-mail security.

segment.source: Create a Registry preference item to turn on encryption:
segment.target: Create a Registry preference item to turn on encryption:

segment.source: In the console tree, right-click AGPM e-mail security, point to New, and then click Registry Item.
segment.target: In the console tree, right-click AGPM e-mail security, point to New, and then click Registry Item.

segment.source: In the New Registry Properties dialog box, select the Update action.
segment.target: In the New Registry Properties dialog box, select the Update action.

segment.source: For Hive, select HKEYLOCALMACHINE.
segment.target: For Hive, select HKEYLOCALMACHINE.

segment.source: For Key Path, type SOFTWAREMicrosoftAGPM.
segment.target: For Key Path, type SOFTWAREMicrosoftAGPM.

segment.source: For Value name, type EncryptSmtp.
segment.target: For Value name, type EncryptSmtp.

segment.source: For Value type, select REGDWORD.
segment.target: For Value type, select REGDWORD.

segment.source: For Base, select Decimal, and for Value data, type 1 to use SSL encryption, or 0 to let e-mail to be sent without encryption.
segment.target: For Base, select Decimal, and for Value data, type 1 to use SSL encryption, or 0 to let e-mail to be sent without encryption.

segment.source: By default, e-mail is sent without encryption.
segment.target: By default, e-mail is sent without encryption.

segment.source: Click OK.
segment.target: Click OK.

segment.source: Create a Registry preference item to specify the SMTP port:
segment.target: Create a Registry preference item to specify the SMTP port:

segment.source: In the console tree, right-click AGPM E-mail security, point to New, and then click Registry Item.
segment.target: In the console tree, right-click AGPM E-mail security, point to New, and then click Registry Item.

segment.source: In the New Registry Properties dialog box, select the Update action.
segment.target: In the New Registry Properties dialog box, select the Update action.

segment.source: For Hive, select HKEYLOCALMACHINE.
segment.target: For Hive, select HKEYLOCALMACHINE.

segment.source: For Key Path dialog box, type SOFTWAREMicrosoftAGPM.
segment.target: For Key Path dialog box, type SOFTWAREMicrosoftAGPM.

segment.source: For Value name, type SmtpPort.
segment.target: For Value name, type SmtpPort.

segment.source: For Value type, select REGDWORD.
segment.target: For Value type, select REGDWORD.

segment.source: For Base, select Decimal, and for Value data, type a port number for the SMTP port.
segment.target: For Base, select Decimal, and for Value data, type a port number for the SMTP port.

segment.source: By default, the SMTP port is port 25 if encryption is not enabled or port 587 if SSL encryption is enabled.
segment.target: By default, the SMTP port is port 25 if encryption is not enabled or port 587 if SSL encryption is enabled.

segment.source: Click OK.
segment.target: Click OK.

segment.source: Close the Group Policy Management Editor window, and then check in and deploy the GPO.
segment.target: Close the Group Policy Management Editor window, and then check in and deploy the GPO.

segment.source: For more information, see Deploy a GPO.
segment.target: For more information, see Deploy a GPO.

segment.source: Additional considerations
segment.target: Additional considerations

segment.source: You must be able to edit and deploy a GPO to configure registry settings by using Group Policy Preferences.
segment.target: You must be able to edit and deploy a GPO to configure registry settings by using Group Policy Preferences.

segment.source: See Editing a GPO and Deploy a GPO for additional detail.
segment.target: See Editing a GPO and Deploy a GPO for additional detail.

segment.source: Additional references
segment.target: Additional references

segment.source: Configuring Advanced Group Policy Management
segment.target: Configuring Advanced Group Policy Management
